channel.title: My IRC .onion gamehub project
channel.description:
I have a running IRC .onion server running ngircd.
I'm planning to add the guide I'm working on([on a secluded subreddit](https://www.reddit.com/r/libregamingdotonion/wiki/ngircd_w14bb)) to the [Onion Services Guides](https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Onion_Services_Guides) eventually. Though before that I'd like to add at least 1 bot(that is some form of a gaming bot) to my own server. I've considered IdleRPG but they don't have a libre license so I'll wait with that one until I run out of options(I hope I don't).
After doing some research I found a topic on github called [ircbot](https://github.com/topics/ircbot). I'm currently looking into onebot and trying to figure out how to work this thing. As part of the instructions on how to get onebot up and running I might have to get python-pip up and running too and deal with something called " virtualenvwrapper". This is probably gonna take a lot of my time.
**Update**:
Gathering from this https://github.com/Whonix/whonixcheck/blob/master/etc/whonix.d/30_whonixcheck_default.conf#L70 I realize python-pip is an unwanted package from a privacy perspective. I'll try to work without that package. Anyway there's a whole list of irc bots. I will find something somewhere, I'm pretty sure of that...sooner or later.
IRC bots that worked to some extent:
* https://github.com/ldilley/rubot (it managed to connect to the server but failed entering a channel)
----
* IRC bot "monop" that hosts monopoly on IRC: https://github.com/thlc/monop-irc ** Licensed under BSD 2-clause. ** (copyright/patent problem? Needs license from original board game vendor to be legal to play? Unclear legal situation?)
